intro: Sisyrinchium angustifolium var. geniculatum, commonly known as the narrow-leaved blue-eyed grass, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to North America. It features slender, grass-like stems that grow up to 30 centimeters tall, adorned with small, lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces clusters of delicate, blue to purple flowers with bright yellow centers, typical of the Iridaceae family. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in wet meadows and along stream banks. This variety is noted for its ornamental value and is sometimes cultivated in gardens for its early spring blooms.
